comments:
RSE Version: Original submission on bug 125719 (Jan. 31, 2006)
Eclipse version: 3.2 M6

I have a working RSE workspace, in which I created some system connections. Among those connections, there was one against system type "FTP Only" which I had defined myself to host subsystems "FTP" and "Daytime".

I now changed the plugin.xml such that my system type is now named "FTP-Daytime". The references in the two subsystems were also changed. When starting RSE with the existing workspace, I got the following Null Pointer Exception, and the Remote Systems View was unusable. When restarting RSE on a clean workspace, everything worked again.

A couple of observations
- Currently system type names instead of ids are used to group subsystems to their types. There is a proposal to change this in an upward compatible fashion. This would fix this particular problem since IDs would remain the same while displayable names could change.
- Any implementation of the id proposal should be robust in the face of an unknown system type id. In particular any persistent data referencing a system type should be able to also reference it by id.

Closing this as a duplicate of the more general 162081 and I will fold these comments into that report.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 162081 ***
